content.p: 59-1-1308. Material advisor penalties. (1) The penalty for failure of a material advisor to disclose a reportable transaction as required by Section 59-1-1306 is $20,000. (2) If a material advisor that is required to disclose a reportable transaction in accordance with Section 59-1-1306 provides false or incomplete information to the commission, the penalty is $20,000. (3) If a material advisor that is required to maintain a list under Section 59-1-1307 fails to make that list available to the commission within a 20-day period after the day on which the commission mails a written request for that list, the material advisor is subject to a penalty of $10,000 for each day that the material advisor fails to make that list available to the commission after the expiration of the 20-day period. (4) A penalty imposed by this section is in addition to any other penalty imposed by this title. Enacted by Chapter 237 , 2006 General Session
The penalty for failure of a material advisor to disclose a reportable transaction as required by Section is $20,000.
If a material advisor that is required to disclose a reportable transaction in accordance with Section provides false or incomplete information to the commission, the penalty is $20,000.

If a material advisor that is required to maintain a list under Section fails to make that list available to the commission within a 20-day period after the day on which the commission mails a written request for that list, the material advisor is subject to a penalty of $10,000 for each day that the material advisor fails to make that list available to the commission after the expiration of the 20-day period.
A penalty imposed by this section is in addition to any other penalty imposed by this title.
